Sanguine got the small ship going at full throttle. She would ram the 
maximal ship and leave it as a pile of smoldering space ruins.

When the corvette collided with the Bullet, Sanguine pressed the 
ejection button and was thrown out in space in the small cockpit. She 
saw the explosion and the wonderful fireworks after that. She smiled 
and shouted to celebrate the destruction.

Just after that, she felt that her escape shuttle was being tugged at 
by Earth's gravity well and she brace for impact. She shapeshifted to 
make sure that the whole cabin was filled with the liquid that morphed 
her so the impact would be lessened on her.

The crash was still hard, but it could have been worse, much worse.

She touched her Predacon insignia and started emitting a strong beacon 
for anyone to track her.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Nic" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Space is boring. The farther you go, the more alone you find 
yourself. 
> And just why would you want to be away from any kinds of 
civilization, 
> alone in the void.
> 
> The predacon shapeshifter had her answer.
> 
> Sanguine was out for revenge.
> 
> She had decided to rejoin Megatron on Earth because she had lost a 
> friend there. Tarantula had died at the hands of the Vok, and 
> primitive Earth was the most probable place where she could find 
them.
> 
> She had just come out of the wormhole and she spotted a small 
maximal 
> ship, clearly built for military purposes. If they were here, a ship 
> was a ressource that was worth destroying...
